content.value: Yuanwu owns a boxing gym where he teaches martial arts and health management. He is well-respected in the community for his cordial demeanor and pleasant temperament.

When exiting during combat, if Readiness is not full, Yuanwu will automatically leave ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"1","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Resonance Skill Thunder Wedge in place.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu is a 4-star Electro Gauntlet wielder Hybrid character who brings more to the table than just damage. His unique Support abilities include a team-wide anti-interruption buff that reduces knockback and stun, and the ability to deal extra break bar damage with his outro, making enemies, particularly bosses, more susceptible to becoming vulnerable.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With an exceptionally short cooldown of 3 seconds, Yuanwu’s skill summons a Thunder Wedge that creates a large circular aura. The wedge helps Yuanwu generate Forte Gauge, and when enemies within its radius take damage, Yuanwu launches a coordinated attack which can be followed by another one after a cooldown of 1.2 seconds from the attack, dealing DEF-based damage and generating additional Forte Gauge.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu’s Forte Gauge grants him access to an enhanced charged skill. When executed, it detonates his Thunder Wedge, unleashing a burst of Electro Damage based on his DEF. After using the Forte, Yuanwu enters a self lightning-infused state, enhancing his combat abilities (this state is exclusive to him and does not affect the team). As his Ultimate and Forte-enhanced skill can cause his Thunder Wedge to detonate, players can strategically use his resonance skill placing a Wedge immediately before activating these abilities for extra detonation damage. The primary usage of Yuanwu’s ability is to generate Concerto Energy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu’s Ultimate inflicts significant Electro Damage based on his DEF and also grants the entire team a 10-second lightning-infused buff. At S0, this buff provides the entire team an anti-interruption aura reducing the chance they’ll be stunned or knocked back for its duration. Despite Yuanwu’s ultimate buff sharing a name with his Forte Ability buff the two operate quite differently.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu is designed to spend minimal time on the field, just enough to utilize his Forte Gauge, unleash his Ultimate, and deploy his Thunder Wedge. While players can extend his time on the field to execute lightning-infused attack combos, these typically do not yield as much damage as other options available to the team. Yuanwu’s damage, although modest if skipping his lightning-infused attack, is still reasonable considering his low field time requirement. His standout feature is the anti-interruption buff he provides, which lasts for 10 seconds and his ability to deal extra break bar damage on his outro making certain situations a little easier.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu is relatively easy to play as a Hybrid character. The key is to maintain his Thunder Wedge on the enemy, use his empowered skill when his Forte is full, and activate his Ultimate as needed.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"It’s important to note Yuanwu’s best abilities scale with DEF% rather than ATK% and he’ll be building with that in mind meaning most typical offensive Echoes that scale on ATK% are less effective for him.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu’s dependance on DEF makes him more reliant on gear compared to other characters as he gains no base DEF from his weapon or inherent flat DEF from his Echos outside of sub stat rolls. If played with focus on dealing damage, his options are quite limited in the early game due to the majority of his DEF scaling coming from character levels. As an alternative Yuanwu can be played as a support by using the Bell-Borne Geochelone Echo, 5P Rejuvenating Glow Echo set and Originite: Type IV healing weapon. Another option that works for both Support focused or damage focused Yuanwu is using Impermanence Heron Echo with 5P Moonlit Clouds set but at the cost of lower damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu’s potential is still being unearthed with players experimenting with how his unique abilities can be integrated into teams and strategies, currently he isn’t seeing a high amount of play in endgame though.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Takes up very little field time","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very easy to play and realize his full potential","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can bring much of his benefit while off the field","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Reduces time it takes to stun Boss enemies","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants anti-interruption aura to the team","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains new supportive abilities with sequences","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"You’ll need to replace his Thunder Wedge often against highly mobile enemies ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Doesn’t bring any offensive buffs as a part of his kit, causing him to fall behind other Hybrid options in total team damage potential","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Scales off Defense instead of Attack making him weaker before max level (weapons and gear don’t grant base Defense)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Acceptable DPS but low total damage making spending any extra field time punishing for overall team output","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

buildInfoOther.substats: Energy Regeneration (Until Breakpoint) >= CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > DEF% > Flat DEF

","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To ensure you have it up in a timely manner we recommend ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"25-35% ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Energy Regen but depending on your chosen team composition and the enemy you're fighting, you may want to invest into the stat more. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
